conclusion: The graph shows the relationship between x (position) on the vertical axis in meters and t² (time squared) on the horizontal axis in s².
At t² = 0, x = 6 m; at t² = 2 s², x = 0 m; the relationship appears to be linear.
The equation of the line can be written as x = mx(t²) + b, where m is the slope and b is the y-intercept.
From the graph, b = 6 m (position at t² = 0).
The slope of the line is calculated as m = (0 - 6)/(2 - 0) = -6/2 = -3 m/s².
The equation of the line is x = -3t² + 6.
The position function x(t) is x(t) = -3t² + 6.
The velocity function is found by differentiating position with respect to time: v(t) = dx/dt = d(-3t² + 6)/dt = -6t.
The acceleration function is found by differentiating velocity with respect to time: a(t) = dv/dt = d(-6t)/dt = -6 m/s².
The magnitude of acceleration is the absolute value of the acceleration: |a| = |-6| = 6 m/s².
The magnitude of the particle's acceleration is 6 m/s².
